unnormalised: Tech startup "DesiCoders" faces legal heat! Sources say "GlobalSoft Inc." has slapped them with a hefty lawsuit alleging blatant copyright infringement. Apparently, DesiCoders' new AI assistant, "ChaiGPT," sounds suspiciously similar to GlobalSoft's "CoffeeAI," even down to the virtual assistant's supposed "desi" accent. A source close to GlobalSoft, who wishes to remain anon., chuckled, "It's like they just copied and pasted the code and then added some Bollywood dialogues. Seriously?"
normalised: Tech startup "DesiCoders" faces legal heat! Sources say "GlobalSoft I-n-c." has slapped them with a hefty lawsuit alleging blatant copyright infringement. Apparently, DesiCoders' new A-I assistant, "Chai G-P-T," sounds suspiciously similar to GlobalSoft's "Coffee A-I," even down to the virtual assistant's supposed "desi" accent. A source close to GlobalSoft, who wishes to remain anonymous, chuckled, "It's like they just copied and pasted the code and then added some Bollywood dialogues. Seriously?"

unnormalised: The crux of the matter? Allegedly, ChaiGPT uses large chunks of CoffeeAI's proprietary code. Legal eagles are sharpening their talons, with some predicting a long and messy court battle. Adv. Sharma, an expert in IP law, commented, "Proving copyright infringement is tricky, but if GlobalSoft can demonstrate substantial similarity, DesiCoders could be in deep doodh-patti!"
normalised: The crux of the matter? Allegedly, Chai G-P-T uses large chunks of Coffee A-I's proprietary code. Legal eagles are sharpening their talons, with some predicting a long and messy court battle. Advocate Sharma, an expert in I-P law, commented, "Proving copyright infringement is tricky, but if GlobalSoft can demonstrate substantial similarity, DesiCoders could be in deep doodh-patti!"

unnormalised: DesiCoders' CEO, Mr. Kumar, vehemently denies the allegations, stating, "ChaiGPT is 100% original! Any similarities are purely coincidental. Maybe GlobalSoft is just jealous because our assistant understands sarcasm and actually tells jokes!" His legal team is reportedly preparing a robust defense, claiming "fair use" and arguing that the AI landscape needs more "desi" flavors.

unnormalised: Social media is having a field day, with #ChaiGPTvsCoffeeAI trending. Memes abound, featuring chai cups battling coffee mugs and legal puns galore. One user tweeted, "This is better than any courtroom drama on TV! Can't wait to see how this masala movie unfolds!" The case is set to be heard in the Delhi High Court on 12/12/2024.

unnormalised: The outcome could have significant implications for the rapidly evolving AI industry in India. If GlobalSoft wins, it could set a precedent for stricter IP protection. If DesiCoders prevails, it will be a victory for homegrown innovation – and a chance for CoffeeAI to learn a few jokes, perhaps. Stay tuned for more updates, folks! This saga promises to be spicier than a plate of momos!
